results.title: What becomes of the broken hearted?
results.creator_credit: Sequel Productions, Bill Gavin and Ian Mune
results.brief_description: It’s five years from where “Once were warriors” left us, and Jake the Muss has turned his back on his family - breaking old habits is not as easy. His long suffering wife, Beth (Rena Owen), has left him and is living with someone new. Jake too has started a new relationship which is punctuated by violence and alcohol abuse. He is reunited with Beth and younger son, Sonny (Clint Eruera), at the funeral of Nig, who died in a gang fight. Tensions flare between Jake and Sonny, and as Sonny delves deeper into the dangerous world of gangs to gain retribution for his elder brother’s death, Jake must face, once and for all, the demons of the past and open up to the possibility of change, and survival.

results.title: What's up Doc?
results.creator_credit: Saticoy Productions, Warner Bros Pictures and Peter Bogdanovich
results.brief_description: Taking its cues from the classic 1930s screwball comedies of Howard Hawks and Preston Sturges, “What’s up Doc” is most reminiscent (more or less a remake) of “Bringing up Baby” (Hawks, 1938). Barbra Streisand plays the flighty university student Judy Maxwell, who has trouble deciding which course she is in, creating chaos wherever she goes with her free-spirited presence. After spying nerdy musicologist Howard Bannister (Ryan O’Neal), Judy decides they are a perfect match and sets her romantic sights on him. As per the genre, Howard has an equally nebbish fiancee, who is of course but a minor obstacle in the course of true love. The film scores lots of laughs with a series of mixed up suitcases, missing jewels, an extensive chase scene, and romantic interludes. “What’s up Doc?” manages a successful mix of rapid fire dialogue, physical comedy and charming lead performances, which made it one of the big hits of 1972, the second in a row for director Peter Bogdanovich (The Last Picture show, Paper moon, The Cat’s meow). Features several songs by Barbra Streisand.

results.title: What's eating Gilbert Grape?
results.creator_credit: Matalon Teper Ohlsson Production, J and M Entertainment, Meir Teper, Bertil Ohlsson, David Matalon and Lasse Hallstrom
results.brief_description: From the acclaimed director of “My life as a dog”, “What’s eating Gilbert Grape?” is a moving and at times comic portrayal of an unusual family in a small town. Gilbert (Johnny Depp) must keep a vigilant eye on his family, particularly his intellectually disabled younger brother Arnie (Leonardo Di Caprio) and his reclusive mother. When a stranger (Juliette Lewis) comes to town, she not only captures his heart, but also turns his life around.

results.title: What's cooking?
results.creator_credit: BeCause Entertainment, Flashpoint Pictures, Jeffrey Taylor and Gurinder Chadha
results.brief_description: Gurinda Chadha (Bend it like Beckham, Bhaji on the beach) directs this familial drama, set in Los Angeles that dissects the interplay between four clans gathered on Thanksgiving Day, a non-religious traditional day of feasting. In the Jewish Seeling family, Mum and Dad struggle to come to terms with their gay daughter, who has brought her girlfriend home for the holiday. Heading a traditional African-American family, Ronald works for a racist senator, whilst his visiting mother mercilessly criticises her daughter-in-law’s every move. Having fled Vietnam the Nguyens live in LA as an extended family, where the teenage children encounter difficulties with assimilation. Lastly, the Avila family celebrate their Latino roots, whilst feeling conflicted by the absence of their ostracised father. A common thread that runs through the film is tolerance and the difficulties inherent in accepting diversity - particularly in relation to the offspring’s choice of partners. Despite this interesting premise, Chadha cannot avoid entertaining a slew of cliches in order to fill the gaps dictated by such a large tapestry. This works against achieving a sense of realism - and many narrative threads wrap up tritely. Nevertheless the film retains a certain charm and it is refreshing to see Americans portrayed that are not white Anglo Saxon. There is the additional pleasure of watching the gastronomic diversity of numerous cultures on display. Cast includes: Dennis Haysbert, Julianna Margulies and Estelle Harris.

results.title: Westray
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Kent Martin and Paul Cowan
results.brief_description: A moving account of the Westray coal mine disaster, which killed 26 men in Nova Scotia on May 9, 1992. Personal stories are brought to the screen in an innovative and dramatic style, tracing the stories of six people - three miners and three widows - whose lives were forever changed that day by a company that violated the most basic rules of mining safety. The film recreates the events that drew the workers to the high-tech mine, detailing the horror of the explosion and its complex and tragic aftermath. ‘Westray’ is a compelling portrait of working men and their wives that extends far beyond this particular mining disaster to highlight how the lives of working class people are often entrusted to companies that violate the most fundamental rules of safety and decency in the name of profit.

results.title: West Side Story
results.creator_credit: Mirisch Corporation, Seven Arts Productions, Robert Wise and Jerome Robbins
results.brief_description: America, “Tonight”, “Maria”, “Somewhere”, “I Feel Pretty” - just some of the sensational evergreen songs from “West Side Story”, the winner of ten Oscars including Best Picture. Opening with the now famous helicopter shot of Manhattan, “West Side Story” is the heart-rending, brilliantly tuneful contemporary version of “Romeo and Juliet”. The gang rivalry between The Jets and the Puerto Rican Sharks reaches fever pitch when ex-Jet Tony falls in love with Maria, the sister of Shark leader Bernardo. When Bernado is killed in a gang misunderstanding, Tony and Maria become the unwilling, tragic participants in the resulting vendetta. Music by Leonard Bernstein. Starring Natalie Wood as Maria, Richard Beymer as Tony, Russ Tamblyn as Riff and Rita Moreno as Anita. Based on the book by Arthur Laurents.

results.title: Welcome to Woop Woop
results.creator_credit: Scala Productions, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Unthank Films, Finola Dwyer and Stephan Elliott
results.brief_description:
Directed by Stephan Elliott, “Welcome to Woop Woop”, was the follow-up film after his smash hit “Priscilla, Queen of the desert”. A black comedy, the film is a satire on the great mythical Australian outback and the people that are said to inhabit it. The film is populated by unsavoury characters, who dress and act repulsively and speak in a crass and offensive dialogue, littered with ockerisms and bush slang. Teddy, a New York con artist flees America and goes on the lam in Australia. Once there is seduced by the sexually voracious Angie and taken to her hometown of Woop Woop where he is effectively imprisoned by the law of Daddy-O, Angie’s tyrannical father. Amongst other eccentric behaviours, the town folk gather nightly to watch “The Sound of music” and “South Pacific” played on a loop at the local drive-in. Elliot confounds viewer expectations offering up more extreme and vulgar outback personalities than could possibly be imagined, making these characters repugnant to watch. The film slyly sends up films such as “Crocodile Dundee” which pandered to the gross stereotypes that so appealed to audiences. Elliot however failed to appeal to anyone with this bizarre and subversive flick, receiving critical brickbats and woeful box office returns.
Cast includes: Johnathon Schaech, Rod Taylor, Susie Porter, Richard Moir, Maggie Kirkpatrick, Barry Humphries and Paul Mercurio

results.title: Welcome to the dollhouse
results.brief_description: Todd Solondz’s debut feature is a darkly funny and bleak tale of the trials and horrors of high school outsiders. “Welcome to the Dollhouse” exacts with excruciating and all too familiar detail the ritualistic and cut throat pecking order of a New Jersey high school. In the title role Solondz has found an unusual alter ego in eleven year old Dawn Wiener (Heather Matarazzo), whose thick glasses, social awkwardness and infantile dress sense have marked her with the cruel nickname of Wiener dog. This has made her into the prime target for every high school bully including Brandon (Brendon Sexton the 3rd), a vicious delinquent who is constantly threatening to rape Dawn after school. Brandon’s promise of sexual assault become one of the many obstacles Dawn must deal with in her unrelenting journey through puberty, along with unsympathetic parents, a younger prissy sister that is unbearably wholesome, and a painful crush on the dreamy school rebel Steve (Eric Mabius). Cast also includes Daria Kalinina, Matthew Faber and Dimitri Iervolino. (Awards: Winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1996 Sundance Film Festival)

results.title: Weird science
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Joel Silver and John Hughes
results.brief_description: John Hughes wrote and and directed this teen farce. Gary and Wyatt are two unpopular geeks in high school who fantasise about having beautiful girlfriends and being the coolest kids in school. Inspired by a clip from the classic film “Frankenstein”, the two decide to try their luck at creating the woman of their dreams. The result is Lisa - beautiful, saucy and the answer to every man’s dream - who becomes a mentor to the two libidinous youths, her mission being to help them get the young women they want. Cast includes: Anthony Michael Hall, Kelly LeBrock, Ilan Mitchell-Smith, Robert Downey Jr. and Bill Paxton.

results.title: Weekend at Bernies (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions, Gladden Entertainment, Victor Drai and Ted Kotcheff
results.brief_description: Larry and Richard have just discovered a fraud and embezzlement scheme that’s costing the insurance company they work for millions. Their Mafia connected boss Bernie is behind the crime and invites them for a weekend so he can rub them out. After some major bungling, it’s Bernie who ends up dead and Larry and Richard have to convince everyone Bernie is alive. As the tagline states, “for a corpse, Bernie sure gets around.” Cast includes Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart and Terry Kiser.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rank Film Productions, Gladden Entertainment, Victor Drai and Ted Kotcheff
results.description: Larry and Richard have just discovered a fraud and embezzlement scheme that’s costing the insurance company they work for millions. Their Mafia connected boss Bernie is behind the crime and invites them for a weekend so he can rub them out. After some major bungling, it’s Bernie who ends up dead and Larry and Richard have to convince everyone Bernie is alive. As the tagline states, “for a corpse, Bernie sure gets around.” Cast includes Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart and Terry Kiser.
